events.1686: After clashes with Mughal soldiers, Jaub Chaarnak left Hoogly and settled in Sutnati.
events.1850: Atma Dev, social reformer and religious leader, was born.
events.1866: Panchkadi Banerjee, famous journalist and editor, was born.
events.1904: Virendranarayan Chakravorthy, former Indian Ambassador in England and Governor of Haryana, was born.
events.1920: Justice Ali Sayyed Murtuza Fazal  was born.
events.1929: The Indian State Air Service, an extension of Imperial Airways' routes, opens its inaugural service from Karachi to Delhi.
events.1931: Leela Nag (Leela Roy), freedom fighter and editor of Jayshri, was arrested in Bengal for her association with "Depali Sangh" who supported Chatgang Ammunition Plot against the Bengal Government.
events.1942: Gangu Bai, freedom fighter from Kolhapur, died at Hinlang Jail because of police beating.
events.1946: Gandhiji completes his month-long sojourn at Srirampur.
events.1948: Ladha Ramji, brother of Amar Singh and played his only Test vs Eng in 1933-34, died at Rajkot.
events.1957: Satyajit Ray's 'Pather Panchali' is declared the best film at the San Francisco Film Festival.
events.1959: Jasu Patel takes 9-69 during India vs Australia tour at Kanpur.
events.1967: Indira Gandhi gets powers to outlaw groups that question sovereignty.
events.1969: Nihalsingh Gurumukh, former Chief Minister of Dehli and Governor of Rajasthan, died.
events.1978: Riots in many Indian cities in protest against Indira Gandhi's imprisonment.
events.1987: Sweden beats India in Gothenburg (5-0) in 76th Tennis Davis Cup .
events.1988: The Constitution (62nd Amendment) Bill for reducing the voting age from 21 to 18 years receives Parliamentary approval.
events.1990: Supreme Court stays Delhi High Court judge Justice Chawla's orders on the Bofors issue.
events.1992: BJP launches campaign to oust Rao government; Vajpayee goes on fast.
events.1994: The last batch of troops of IAF left the capital city of Mogadishu. The First batch reinducted was of 10 IAF personnel. Cpl Nasir was left as a lying casualty due to injuries sustained in the RPG explosion by AN-124 contracted by UN.
events.1998: Dr. B. V. Raman (86), a reputed astrologer, dies in Bangalore following a cardiac arrest. He was the Editor of The Astrological Magazine.
events.1999: Mulayam Singh Yadav, Samajwadi Party Chief, opposes signing of CTBT.
events.2000: Atal Behari Vajpayee, Prime Minister, announces the Government's decision to extend J&K ceasefire till January 26, 2001.
